article:
'Gordon Research Conferences' are a group of prestigious international
scientific conferences organized by a non-profit organization of the same name.
The conference topics cover frontier research in the biological, chemical, and
physical sciences, and their related technologies. The conferences have been
held since 1931, and have expanded to almost 200 conferences per year.
Conference locations are chosen partly for their scenic and often isolated
nature, to encourage an informal community atmosphere. Contributions are "off-
record" to encourage free discussion, often of unpublished research. Conferences
were extended to cover science education in 1991. The conference
topics are regularly publicised in the journal [[Science (journal)|Science]]:
2010, 2009,
2008, 2007,
and 2006.
